headings.title: ADR-042: Use Event Sourcing for Order Service
Flow: Request → Generate ID → Pass to all services → Include in all telemetry
Bad: user_id as label (millions of values)
Good: status_code as label (handful of values)
Store full traces short-term, aggregates long-term
Revert to last known good version
Search all logs across all services
Find what else spiked when issue started
Bad SLI: Average latency (can hide problems)
Too noisy, no context, no action

frontmatter.title: Circuit Breaker Pattern
frontmatter.description: Prevent cascade failures in distributed systems by failing fast when services are unhealthy
frontmatter.when_to_use: External service calls, microservice communication, database connections
frontmatter.when_not_to_use: Internal method calls, non-network operations, CPU-bound tasks

frontmatter.title: Consensus Pattern
frontmatter.description: Achieving agreement among distributed nodes in the presence of failures
frontmatter.problem_solved: Distributed agreement without single point of failure
frontmatter.when_to_use: Leader election, distributed configuration, replicated state machines
frontmatter.when_not_to_use: High-throughput data processing, eventually consistent systems

frontmatter.title: CQRS (Command Query Responsibility Segregation)
frontmatter.description: Separate read and write models for optimized performance and scalability
frontmatter.problem_solved: Conflicting requirements between read and write operations
frontmatter.when_to_use: High-performance reads, complex domain logic, different read/write scaling needs
frontmatter.when_not_to_use: Simple CRUD applications, low traffic systems, small teams

headings.title: Real-World Case Study: Uber's Distributed Lock

frontmatter.title: Event Sourcing Pattern
frontmatter.description: Store all changes as events rather than current state - the log is the truth
frontmatter.problem_solved: Loss of historical data, audit requirements, temporal queries
frontmatter.when_to_use: Audit trails, complex domains, time-travel debugging, event-driven systems
frontmatter.when_not_to_use: Simple CRUD, storage constraints, real-time queries

frontmatter.title: Retry & Backoff Strategies
frontmatter.description: Handle transient failures gracefully with intelligent retry logic and exponential backoff
frontmatter.when_to_use: Network calls, external APIs, distributed services, temporary failures
frontmatter.when_not_to_use: Permanent failures, business logic errors, data validation failures
